content:
I was making PR to the cargo reference about "strict version requirements" for Cargo.toml.

@Alex Crichton responded with:

cargostrict version requirements like this are generally an anti-pattern on crates.io itself so we tend to advise against it (if you're up for it calling out the hazards of publishing a crate with strict version requirements, would also be great).

Why specifying the strict version is considered a anti-pattern? (I need to understand it to finish the PR :thinking: ).

PR link: https://github.com/rust-lang/cargo/pull/9961
